explanation: - UtAssert_CaseType_t: needed to know whether the controlling expression (CaseType) is an enum/typedef and whether its values are compile-time constants or can vary at runtime.\n- UTASSERT_CASETYPE_* (all enumerators listed): the actual definitions/values of these case labels are required to determine if the switch is effectively switching over a compile-time constant or an invariant set (e.g., if they are #defines or have fixed single value semantics that could make the expression invariant).\n- UT_BSP_DoText: this function is the caller that directly invokes UtAssert_GetCaseTypeAbbrev (per the call graph). Its implementation determines what value is passed into CaseType; inspecting it is necessary to determine whether CaseType can vary at runtime or is always a constant/invariant in actual use.
